title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-4.80 - Personnel
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-4.80 - Personnel

State Regulations

All persons handling food are to be free from infectious disease which can be transmitted by foods and are not to have a boil, infected cut or sore, or respiratory disease. They are to wear clean clothing, not to smoke or use tobacco while handling food or in food preparation areas, and to use hair restraints that minimize hair contact with hands, food and food-contact surfaces. All personnel handling food are to wash their hands with soap and water after using the toilet, smoking, eating, or when soiled. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
14-4.80

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
